intro: Raphione pallens, commonly known as the pale raphione, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with finely divided leaflets that give it a delicate appearance. Raphione pallens is often found in temperate regions and is noted for its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
